document.ModsDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)
document.docAuthor: Van Dam, Matthew H., Laufa, Raymond & Riedel, Alexander
document.docTitle: Trigonopterus puncticollis Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

caption.paragraph: Figure 3. Trigonopterus puncticollis Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n., holotype; a Dorsal habitus b Lateral habitus c Penis.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype (ANIC): ARC4220 (GenBank # KU888900), PAPUA NEW GUINEA, West New Britain Prov.: E of Silali Village, Nakanai Range, S 05°30.651' , E 151°02.895' , 700 m, from foliage, 21-XI-2014. Paratypes (SMNK, ZSM, UPNG): 9 exx, ARC4218 (EMBL # KU888898), ARC4219 (GenBank # KU888899), ARC4221 (EMBL # XXX), same data as holotype.
This epithet is a Latin adjective based on a combination of the Latin nouns punctum (small hole, dot) and collum (neck) and refers to the markedly punctate pronotum.
This species may belong to the Trigonopterus oblongus -group of Riedel et al. (2013b) in a wide sense.
